extendedIngredients.name: butter lettuce
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 heads Bibb or butter lettuce, chopped

extendedIngredients.name: extra virgin olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¾ cup extra virgin olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: fingerling potatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 lb new or fingerling potatoes (quartered for new, halved for fingerling)

extendedIngredients.name: grape tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ lb cherry or grape tomatoes, halved

extendedIngredients.name: haricots verts
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ lb haricot verts (French green beans), cut into 2-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: lemon juice
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup fresh squeezed lemon juice

extendedIngredients.name: red onion
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ small red onion, sliced thin

extendedIngredients.name: tempeh
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 8 oz package tempeh, sliced once lengthwise and cut into one inch pieces

recipes.title: Tempeh Nicoise Salad

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Gruener Veltliner, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Salad. Sauvignon Blanc and Gruner Veltliner both have herby notes that complement salads with enough acid to match tart vinaigrettes, while a Chardonnay can be a good pick for creamy salad dressings. One wine you could try is Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay. It has 5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 20 dollars.

productMatches.title: Waterbrook Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Beautiful and golden in color, this chardonnay has persistent ripe pear and lychee flavors that are complemented by a subtle, sweet toasty oak. Very balanced acid harmonizes the thick viscosity of this ripe and decadent wine.

recipes.instructions: In a small bowl, whisk the dressing ingredients together and set aside.Heat about an inch of water in a stockpot over medium-high heat. Arrange potatoes evenly in a steamer basket and place in the pot. Cover and steam for 20 minutes, until potatoes can be easily pierced with a knife. Set aside to cool slightly, then toss with ¼ cup of dressing.In the same pot, place the tempeh in the steamer basket. Cover and steam for 10 minutes, then remove and toss with ¼ cup of dressing. Set aside.Add additional water to the pot if necessary, then place the green beans in the steamer basket. Steam for 3-4 minutes (they should still be crisp). Remove and toss with ¼ cup of dressing.Combine tomatoes and sliced red onion in a small bowl and toss with ¼ cup of dressing.While any of the above are steaming, toss the lettuce with ¼ cup of dressing, then place on a large platter. When the cooked ingredients are room temperature, arrange them individually on the bed of lettuce, and add the tomato mixture, olives, and eggs. Drizzle the salad with any remaining dressing and serve immediately.

steps.step: In a small bowl, whisk the dressing ingredients together and set aside.

Heat about an inch of water in a stockpot over medium-high heat. Arrange potatoes evenly in a steamer basket and place in the pot. Cover and steam for 20 minutes, until potatoes can be easily pierced with a knife. Set aside to cool slightly, then toss with ¼ cup of dressing.In the same pot, place the tempeh in the steamer basket. Cover and steam for 10 minutes, then remove and toss with ¼ cup of dressing. Set aside.
Add additional water to the pot if necessary, then place the green beans in the steamer basket. Steam for 3-4 minutes (they should still be crisp).
Remove and toss with ¼ cup of dressing.

Combine tomatoes and sliced red onion in a small bowl and toss with ¼ cup of dressing.While any of the above are steaming, toss the lettuce with ¼ cup of dressing, then place on a large platter. When the cooked ingredients are room temperature, arrange them individually on the bed of lettuce, and add the tomato mixture, olives, and eggs.
Drizzle the salad with any remaining dressing and serve immediately.
